column1: Risk factors for BPD include: - Abandonment in childhood or adolescence - Disrupted family life - Poor communication in the family - Sexual, physical, or emotional abuse BPD tends to occur more often in women and among hospitalized psychiatric people.
In some cases, they can improve mood swings and treat depression or other disorders that may occur with BPD.
See your health care provider if you or someone you know has symptoms of borderline personality disorder.
